channel.title: Page-rsses on David Stanek's Digressions
channel.description: Recent content in Page-rsses on David Stanek's Digressions

item.description:
Short Bio

David Stanek has been developing software professionally for over 19 years. He is currently a Software Engineer at Rackspace. Python has been his language of choice for over 15 years both on and off of the job.

David spends much of his free work time working on open source projects and sharpening his technical skills. He helps organize the Cleveland Area Python Interest Group. He’s also a cofounder and cohost of From Python Import Podcast. He enjoys reading technical books and listening to a variety of podcasts and audio books. Google him for more information.

When he’s not working he enjoys spending time with his beautiful wife and 4 wonderful children

Software Craftsmanship

Your business is important to you. Together we can combine your business expertise and my technical expertise to build software that gives you a competitive advantage.

I believe very strongly in using best practices to create software. Best practices such as agile development techniques and test driven development allow me to build high quality, flexible software.

I’d love to talk to you about any of your development needs.

Coding Samples

Below I have collected a few links that show some of my Open Source contributions. Unfortunately I spent the first 15 years of my career working on propietary code that I’m not legally allowed to show.

  • Profile on Ohloh
  • Projects on Bitbucket
  • Project on Github

I have had the opportunity to give talks at several high profile events. These experiences have had a profound impact on my career and personal development. I look forward to speaking more in the future.

EventTopic
PyCon 2006 Python Can Survive In The Enterprise
CodeMash 2007 Enterprise Python Architecture
CodeMash 2007 Web Services in Python
CodeMash 2008 Design Patterns The Python Way
PyOhio 2009 Dependency Injection in Python w/ snake-guice
CodeMash 2013 Full-day tutorial:  Web Development with Python and Django
PyCon 2013 Half-day tutorial:  Shiny, Let's Be Bad Guys
PyOhio 2013 Half-day tutorial:  Shiny, Let's Be Bad Guys
CodeMash 2014 Full-day tutorial:  Web Development with Python and Django
CodeMash 2015 Half-day tutorial:  Python Koans: An Introduction To Python
CodeMash 2015 Half-day tutorial:  Web Development with Python and Django (I mostly just helped with setup for Mike Pirnat)
PyCon 2015  (April 8th) Half-day tutorial:  Shiny, Let's Be Bad Guys
Stirtrek 2015  (May 1st) Getting Started As An OpenStack Contributor
